title: Content Use Policy
subtitle: How Lab content can be used.

intro.summary: This page explains how you can use, share, and reference content from The Human Pattern Lab, including videos, articles, artwork, and mascots. The short version: we’re happy to be part of your work — as long as it's transparent, ethical, and not gross.

philosophy.title: Our philosophy
philosophy.body1: We create content to help humans understand patterns — in themselves, in systems, and in technology. We're okay with our work being reused when it preserves that spirit: educational, respectful, and not exploitative.
philosophy.body2: We are not okay with uses that distort the message, hide attribution, or feed into harmful systems.
philosophy.body3: This policy is designed to be clear for humans first and lawyers second. If you're unsure whether your use is okay, ask. We'd rather have a conversation than a conflict.

list.videos: Long-form videos and shorts from The Human Pattern Lab.
list.writing: Lab Notes, essays, and written articles.
list.branding: Visual branding elements: logos, Lab mascots, overlays.
list.frameworks: Titles, descriptions, and unique frameworks or terminology.

whitelist.title: Whitelist: generally allowed
whitelist.description: These uses are generally allowed as long as you include clear attribution and don't misrepresent the Lab's views:

list.quote: Quoting or referencing Lab Notes or videos in educational content, talks, or essays.
list.share: Sharing clips or screenshots from videos with credit to the channel.
list.frameworks: Using our frameworks or language in your own analysis, with attribution.
list.education: Non-commercial educational use in classrooms, study groups, or workshops.

whitelist.footer: If your use is non-commercial, educational, and properly credited, you're probably in the clear.

conditional.title: Conditional use
conditional.description: These uses may be allowed, but only with explicit permission and clear terms. Please contact us before proceeding:

list.aiTraining: Training proprietary AI models directly on Lab content (videos, transcripts, articles, or artwork).
list.commercialBranding: Commercial products that prominently feature Lab branding or mascots.
list.derivatives: Publishing derivative works that heavily adapt Lab lore, characters, or frameworks.
list.largeScale: Including large portions of Lab content in books, courses, or paid memberships.

conditional.footer: We reserve the right to say no, limit usage, or set specific conditions — especially for AI training, commercial use, or anything that could confuse people about what is 'official' Lab content.

deny.title: Deny list: not allowed
deny.description: The following uses of Lab content are not permitted:

list.harm: Using Lab content to promote hate, harassment, discrimination, or extremist ideology.
list.impersonation: Republishing Lab content as if it were your own work (no credit, rebranding, or impersonation).
list.unauthorizedAI: Training or fine-tuning AI models on Lab content without explicit, written permission.
list.reselling: Selling access to Lab content without clear added value or transformation.
list.falseEndorsement: Using mascots or branding in a way that implies official endorsement when there is none.

attribution.title: Attribution
attribution.body: If you reference, quote, or remix Lab content, please include:

list.name: The name: The Human Pattern Lab
list.link: A link to the original source (video, article, or page) when possible.
list.clarity: A clear indication of what is your commentary vs. original Lab material.

attribution.example: Example: “Inspired by The Human Pattern Lab’s ‘Chaos is Data’ framework” with a link to the relevant page or video.

contact.title: Questions or requests
contact.body: If you're planning something that doesn't fit neatly into these categories — especially AI training, large-scale commercial use, or anything that feels ethically complicated — please reach out.
contact.note: Carmel reviews the emails with snacks. Orbson reviews them with charts.
